fields.name: Think
fields.description:
The `think` function called every frame that will animate the panel object. This varies based on the animation. You can create a custom function for this if you aren't using the stock panel methods.

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="animData">This structure.</arg>
<arg type="Panel" name="tgtPanel">The panel the animation is being run on.</arg>
</callback>
<arg type="number" name="fraction">The progress fraction of the animation, between 0 and 1. The change rate of this number will not be linear if you are easing.</arg>

fields.name: Pos
fields.description: The target position, or target translation of the panel object. Used by <page>Panel:MoveTo</page> and <page>Panel:MoveBy</page> respectively.

fields.name: StartPos
fields.description: The position of the panel object when the animation started. Used by <page>Panel:MoveTo</page> and <page>Panel:MoveBy</page>.

fields.name: SizeX
fields.description: Whether to resize the panel horizontally or not. Only used by <page>Panel:SizeTo</page>.

fields.name: SizeY
fields.description: Whether to resize the panel vertically or not. Only used by <page>Panel:SizeTo</page>.

fields.name: Size
fields.description: The target size of the panel object. Only used by <page>Panel:SizeTo</page>.

fields.name: StartSize
fields.description: The size of the panel object when the animation started. Only used by <page>Panel:SizeTo</page>.

fields.name: Color
fields.description: The target colour of the panel object. Only used by <page>Panel:ColorTo</page>.

fields.name: StartColor
fields.description: The colour of the panel object when the animation started. Only used by <page>Panel:ColorTo</page>.

fields.name: Alpha
fields.description: The target alpha (0-255) of the panel object. Only used by <page>Panel:AlphaTo</page>.

fields.name: StartAlpha
fields.description: The alpha (0-255) of the panel object when the animation started. Only used by <page>Panel:AlphaTo</page>.

fields.name: Speed
fields.description: The speed to use for transitions when using linear interpolation (Lerp) animations. Only used by <page>Panel:LerpPositions</page>.

fields.name: UseGravity
fields.description: Whether or not to use easing to make the panel 'jump' at its target, slowing as it approaches. Only used by <page>Panel:LerpPositions</page>.

fields.name: s
fields.description: The entity's scale manipulation of the bone

fields.name: a
fields.description: The entity's angle manipulation of the bone

fields.name: p
fields.description: The entity's position manipulation of the given bone

description:
Structure used for storing/restoring bone manipulations.
Data is stored from <page>Entity:GetManipulateBoneScale</page>, <page>Entity:GetManipulateBoneAngles</page>, and <page>Entity:GetManipulateBonePosition</page>.
Data is restored using <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneScale</page>, <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles</page>, and <page>Entity:ManipulateBonePosition</page>.

The function <page>duplicator.DoBoneManipulator</page> and <page>Structures/EntityCopyData</page> use a table
containing a BoneManipulationData structure for each bone (that has manipulations applied) with the bone ID as the struct index in the table.

Fields **s**, **a**, and **p** are set if they don't equal **Vector( 1, 1, 1 )**, **Angle( 0, 0, 0 )**, and **Vector( 0, 0, 0 )** respectively.
name: BoneManipulationData

fields.name: Attacker
fields.description:
The entity that should be reported as attacker eg. a player

By default this would be set to the entity <page>Entity:FireBullets</page> is called on.

fields.name: Callback
fields.description:
Function to be called **after** the bullet was fired but **before** the damage is applied (the callback is called even if no damage is applied).

<callback>
<arg type="Entity" name="attacker"></arg>
<arg type="table" name="tr">See <page>Structures/TraceResult</page></arg>
<arg type="CTakeDamageInfo" name="dmgInfo"></arg>
<ret type="table">
The return value can be a table with following keys:
* <page>boolean</page> effects - `false` to not do any of the effects.
* <page>boolean</page> damage - `false` to not do any damage.
</ret>
</callback>

fields.name: Damage

If set to `0`, it means the damage should be calculated from the ammo type's <page>ConVar</page>s if  the ammo type has `AMMO_INTERPRET_PLRDAMAGE_AS_DAMAGE_TO_PLAYER` flag set.
See <page>Structures/AmmoData</page>.

Each describes where their border starts, (`left`+`right`) and (`top`+`bottom`) should equal `0` to center on the view position.

fields.name: OurOldAngularVelocity

fields.name: TheirOldAngularVelocity
fields.description: Old angular velocity of the entity we collided with

description:
Passed as argument of <page>ENTITY:PhysicsCollide</page>, <page>EFFECT:PhysicsCollide</page> and used with <page>Entity:AddCallback</page>.

<note>Sometimes, the value of `Speed` can be different from getting the length calculated from `OurOldVelocity`, even though they should be the same, or close to same. It's recommended to do `OurOldVelocity:Length()` instead.

```
function ENT:PhysicsCollide( colData, collider )
-- you may get two completely different values, and the second one should be more accurate.
print(colData.Speed)
print(colData.OurOldVelocity:Length())
end
```
</note>

fields.name: func
fields.description:
Reference to the function that was passed in. If a stack level was specified, this will be the function at that stack level. 0 = debug.getinfo, 1 = function that called debug.getinfo, etc.

**Option: f**

fields.name: linedefined
fields.description:
The line where the function definiton starts (where "function" is located).

**Option: S**

fields.name: lastlinedefined
fields.description:
The line the function definition ended (where "end" is located).

**Option: S**

fields.name: source
fields.description:
The path to the file where the passed function is defined prepended by an @ (ex. "@lua/autorun/mytestfile.lua"). This will be the <page>Global.CompileString</page> or <page>Global.RunString</page> identifier if the function wasn't defined in a file, also prepended by an @.

**Option: S**

fields.name: short_src
fields.description:
The shortened name of the source (without the @). May be truncated if the source path is long.

**Option: S**

fields.name: what
fields.description:
The language used. Either "Lua" or "C".

**Option: S**

fields.name: currentline
fields.description:
The current line. This will be -1 if the code is not executed from a file.

**Option: l** (lowercase L)

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The function name. This will be nil if the name cannot be found. Only works if stack level is passed rather than function pointer.

**Option: n**

fields.name: namewhat
fields.description:
The function "type". This will be "global", "local", "method", "field". Can also be an empty string if the function name could not be found. Only works if stack level is passed rather than function pointer.

**Option: n**

fields.name: isvararg
fields.description:
Whether the function is variadic (has a `...` argument).

**Option: u**

fields.name: nparams
fields.description:
The number of arguments the function uses excluding varargs.

**Option: u**

fields.name: nups
fields.description:
Upvalue count. Max index that can be used with <page>debug.getupvalue</page>. C functions can have upvalues but they cannot be accessed from Lua.

**Option: u**

fields.name: activelines
fields.description:
A table of all the active lines in the function - that is, lines with code that actually does something (not blank lines or lines with comments only).

The table keys will be line numbers, and their values will all be true. Lines that are inactive are simply not included in the table - they have the value nil.

It doesn't check for activeline in subfunctions.

**Option: L**

description:
Table returned by <page>debug.getinfo</page>.

<note>If a filter is applied to <page>debug.getinfo</page>, some members may not exist!</note>

For functions defined in C/C++, the following members will always have the given values:
* what = "C"
* source = "[C]"
* nparams = 0
* isvararg = true
* namewhat = ""
* short_src = "[C]"
* linedefined = -1
* currentline = -1
* lastlinedefined = -1
name: DebugInfo

fields.name: brightness
fields.description: The brightness of the light.

fields.name: decay
fields.description:
Fade out speed.
Here's a formula for calculating Decay for your light: 1000 / fadeOutTimeInSeconds. For example setting decay to 1000 would fade out the light in 1 second, 2000 - 0.5 seconds.

fields.name: dietime
fields.description:
Time after which light will be removed.

This is relative to <page>Global.CurTime</page>. If you put in a value that is less than or equal to <page>Global.CurTime</page>, the light will not behave properly.

Note, that it does not affect fading out. Light will be removed regardless of it being fully faded out or not.

fields.name: dir
fields.description: The light direction. Used with **InnerAngle** and **OuterAngle**.

fields.name: innerangle
fields.description: The closer this is to zero, the smoother the light will be. Requires **Dir** and **OuterAngle** to be set.

fields.name: outerangle
fields.description: The angle of the Dynamic Light. Requires **Dir** to be set.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Makes the light brighter and flicker? Changing the value does not seem to affect anything.

fields.name: minlight
fields.description: Minimum light

fields.name: noworld
fields.description: Don't light the world. Has no effect for elights since they never light the world.

fields.name: nomodel
fields.description: Don't light models

fields.name: pos
fields.description: Position of the light

fields.name: size
fields.description: Radius of the light

fields.name: style
fields.description: Flicker style, see [this page](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Light_dynamic#Appearances) for examples.

fields.name: b
fields.description: The blue part of the color

fields.name: g
fields.description: The green part of the color

fields.name: r
fields.description: The red part of the color

description:
Structure for <page>Global.DynamicLight</page>.
All members are case insensitive.

<note>This is an actual class named **dlight_t**, not a table.</note>
name: DynamicLight

fields.name: SoundName
fields.description:
The file path of the played sound.

Sounds prefixed with ) tell the sound engine that it is a spatial sound; this allows the sound to emit from a specific location within the world.

Sounds prefixed with ^ tell the sound engine that it is a distance based sound. The left channel of the .wav is the 'near' sound that will play when the sound originates close to you, and the right channel is the 'far' sound that will play when the sound originates far from you.

fields.name: OriginalSoundName
fields.description:
The original file path or soundscript name.

Even if the SoundName value is changed, the OriginalSoundName value will remain the same.

Sounds may be returned as soundscripts (for example, "Weapon_357.Single") instead of the sound's file path. You can use <page>sound.GetProperties</page> to retrieve the actual file path.

fields.name: SoundTime
fields.description:
The time at which the sound should be played.

If equal to 0 or CurTime(), the sound is played immediately. If greater than CurTime(), the sound is played with a delay. If less than CurTime(), part of the sound is skipped.

fields.name: DSP
fields.description:
The DSP (digital signal processing) preset applied to the sound.

There are approximately 134 different presets defined by the Source engine between 0 and 133. These presets represent different types of 'rooms' or environments.

[List of DSP's](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets)

fields.name: SoundLevel
fields.description:
The sound's attenuation, a number between 0 (low) and 511 (high)

This determines how fast the sound drops away. A higher value means the sound can be heard farther away.

See <page>Enums/SNDLVL</page>.

fields.name: Pitch
fields.description: The pitch of the played sound, a number between 0 (low) and 255 (high), where 100 is the sound's original pitch.

fields.name: Flags
fields.description: The bit flags of the played sound. See <page>Enums/SND</page> for available options.

fields.name: Channel
fields.description: The sound's channel. See <page>Enums/CHAN</page> for available options.

fields.name: Volume
fields.description: The volume of the played sound, return as a decimal number between 0 (low) and 1 (high).

fields.name: Entity
fields.description: The entity that played the sound.

fields.name: Pos
fields.description: The origin of the played sound.

fields.name: Base
fields.description: The base entity to derive from. This **must** be a valid Lua entity

fields.name: Type
fields.description:
Type of the entity. This **must** be one of these:
* **anim**
* **brush**
* **point**
* **ai**
* **nextbot**
* **filter**

See <page>Scripted Entities</page> for a more detailed explanation of what each one is.

fields.name: ClassName
fields.description:
The class name of the entity (File or folder name of your entity).
**This is set automatically _after_ the entity file is loaded.**

fields.name: ClassNameOverride
fields.description: If set, overrides the classname of the SWEP.

fields.name: Folder
fields.description: The folder from where the entity was loaded. This should always be "entity/ent_myentity", regardless whether your entity is stored as a file, or multiple files in a folder. **This is set automatically _before_ the entity file is loaded.**

fields.name: AutomaticFrameAdvance
fields.description: Set this to true if your entity has animations. You should also apply changes to the <page>ENTITY:Think</page> function from the example on that page.

fields.name: Category
fields.description: Spawnmenu category to put the entity into

fields.name: Spawnable
fields.description: Whether this entity should be displayed and is spawnable in the spawn menu

fields.name: Editable
fields.description: Whether the entity supports Editing. See <page>Editable Entities</page> for more info.

fields.name: AdminOnly
fields.description: Whether or not only admins can spawn the entity from their spawn menu

fields.name: PrintName
fields.description: Nice name of the entity to appear in the spawn menu

fields.name: Author
fields.description: The author of the entity

fields.name: Contact
fields.description: The contacts of the entity creator

fields.name: Purpose
fields.description: The purpose of the entity creation

fields.name: Instructions
fields.description: How to use your entity

fields.name: RenderGroup
fields.description: The entity's render group, see <page>Enums/RENDERGROUP</page>. If unset, the engine will decide the render group based on the entity's model.

fields.name: WantsTranslucency
fields.description: If set and RenderGroup is not, will switch the render group to <page text="RENDERGROUP_BOTH">Enums/RENDERGROUP#RENDERGROUP_BOTH</page> when appropriate.

fields.name: DisableDuplicator
fields.description: Disable the ability for players to duplicate this entity.

fields.name: ScriptedEntityType
fields.description:
Sets the spawnmenu content icon type for the entity, used by spawnmenu in the Sandbox-derived gamemodes.
See <page>spawnmenu.AddContentType</page> for more information.

fields.name: DoNotDuplicate
fields.description: If set, the entity will not be duplicated via the built-in duplicator system.

fields.name: IconOverride
fields.description:
If set, overrides the icon path to be displayed in the Spawnmenu for this entity.

Like many functions, this expects a path relative to the `materials/` folder, do not include `materials/` in the provided string.

fields.name: PhysgunDisabled
fields.description: If set, the entity forbid physgun interaction.

fields.name: PhysicsSolidMask
fields.description:
If set, a bitflag for the physics solidity of the entity. See <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page>.

Can be used to make the entity pass though certain otherwise solid meshes, such as grates, or special clip brushes.

<note>This only works for `nextbot`, `anim` and `ai` type SENTs.</note>

description:
Information about the ENT structure, which represents a Scripted Entity class definition.

To learn more about scripted entities, <page text="see this page">Scripted_Entities</page>.

See also <page>ENTITY Hooks</page> for a list of events scripted entities can have. See <page>Custom Entity Fields</page> for a list of events and fields all entities can have.

While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so addons could use their values.

<note>Values defined in ENT table can't be changed per instance. Initialize default values in <page>ENTITY:Initialize</page> or other hook.</note>
name: ENT

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The entity's name, see <page>Entity:GetName</page>.

fields.name: Class
fields.description: The entity's class name, see <page>Entity:GetClass</page>.

fields.name: Pos
fields.description: The entity's position, relative to the duplication origin point.

fields.name: Angle
fields.description: The entity's angle, relative to the duplication angle.

fields.name: DT
fields.description: The entity's Network Vars, see <page>ENTITY:SetupDataTables</page> and <page>Networking Entities</page>.

fields.name: Model
fields.description: The entity's model, see <page>Entity:GetModel</page>.

fields.name: ModelScale
fields.description: The entity's model scale, see <page>Entity:GetModelScale</page>. This will only be present if the model scale isn't 1.

fields.name: Skin
fields.description: The entity's active skin, see <page>Entity:GetSkin</page>.

fields.name: ColGroup
fields.description: The entity's collision group, see <page>Entity:GetCollisionGroup</page>. Uses the <page>Enums/COLLISION_GROUP</page>.

fields.name: Mins
fields.description: The entity's collision bound minimums, see <page>Entity:GetCollisionBounds</page>.

fields.name: Maxs
fields.description: The entity's collision bound maximums, see <page>Entity:GetCollisionBounds</page>.

fields.name: PhysicsObjects
fields.description: Data about the entity's <page>PhysObj</page>s, see <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page>. The key is the physics object index (starts from 0), and the value is a <page>Structures/PhysicsObjectSave</page>. Unlike other tables in this structure, if there are no physics objects for this entity this will be an empty table.

fields.name: FlexScale
fields.description: The entity's Flex Scale, see <page>Entity:GetFlexScale</page>.

fields.name: Flex
fields.description: Each flex bone's flex weight, see <page>Entity:GetFlexWeight</page>. The key is the flex's index and the value is the weight. Only flexes with a non-default (nonzero) weight are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.

fields.name: BodyG
fields.description: The entity's body groups, see <page>Entity:GetBodygroup</page>. The key is the bodygroup ID and the value is the assigned bodygroup number. Only body groups with a non-default (> 0) value are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.

fields.name: BoneManip
fields.description: Bone manipulation data, see <page>Entity:HasBoneManipulations</page>. The key is the bone index and the value is a <page>Structures/BoneManipulationData</page>. Only bones that have been manipulated with non-default values are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.

fields.name: MapCreationID
fields.description: The entity's MapCreationID, only exists for entities that were created by the map. See <page>Entity:MapCreationID</page>.

fields.name: WorkshopID
fields.description: Deprecated, always 0. See <page>Entity:GetWorkshopID</page>.

description:
Data structure used by the <page>duplicator</page> to store and load entity data.

It is created by <page>duplicator.CopyEntTable</page> and can be loaded by <page>duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable</page>.

It also shows up in several other contexts:
* <page>duplicator.RegisterEntityClass</page>
* <page>ENTITY:OnEntityCopyTableFinish</page>
* <page>ENTITY:OnDuplicated</page>

<note>In addition to all fields listed here, any field saved on the entity will be saved as-is to this table. For example, if you set `ent.FavoriteFood = "Steak"` before duplicating it, this structure will also contain the field `FavoriteFood` with the value `"Steak"`.</note>
name: EntityCopyData

fields.name: font
fields.description:
The font source. Custom font files are stored in resource/fonts/.

The length is limited to 31 characters maximum.

<warning>This must be the actual 'nice' font, not a file name. Unless the client is running Linux or macOS. (<page>Finding the Font Name</page>)

This also cannot be an already registered font, i.e. you cannot base your font from any of the <page text="Default Fonts">Default_Fonts</page></warning>

fields.name: extended
fields.description: Allow the font to display glyphs that are outside of the Latin-1 range. Unicode code points above 0xFFFF are not supported.

fields.name: size
fields.description:
The font height in pixels

`Range:` 4 - 255

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The font boldness

fields.name: blursize
fields.description:
The strength of the font blurring

`Range:` 0 - 80

fields.name: scanlines
fields.description:
The "scanline" interval
Must be > 1 to work. This setting is per blursize per font - so if you create a font using "Arial" without scanlines, you cannot create an Arial font using scanlines with the same blursize

fields.name: antialias
fields.description: Smooth the font

fields.name: underline
fields.description: Add an underline to the font

fields.name: italic
fields.description: Make the font italic

fields.name: strikeout
fields.description: Add a strike through

fields.name: symbol
fields.description: Enables the use of symbolic fonts such as Webdings

fields.name: rotary
fields.description: Seems to add a line in the middle of each letter

fields.name: shadow
fields.description: Add shadow casting to the font

fields.name: additive
fields.description: Additive rendering

fields.name: outline
fields.description:
Add a black outline to the font.

This does not work well with antialias, and only allows black 1-pixel outlines. It may be preferable to not use this parameter, and instead use <page>draw.SimpleTextOutlined</page> when drawing text that you want outlined.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The fancy name of your gamemode.

fields.name: Author
fields.description: The name/contact info of the gamemode author.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: The contact email associated with the gamemode.

fields.name: Website
fields.description: The website associated with the gamemode.

fields.name: FolderName
fields.description: The name of the gamemode folder, automatically set.

fields.name: Folder
fields.description: The name of the gamemode folder prepended with "gamemodes/" (such as "gamemodes/sandbox"), automatically set.

fields.name: TeamBased
fields.description: Set this to true if your gamemode is team-based. Used to enable/disable the base gamemode team system.

fields.name: IsSandboxDerived
fields.description: True if the gamemode is derived from sandbox.

fields.name: ThisClass
fields.description: The name of the gamemode folder prepended with "gamemode_" (such as "gamemode_sandbox"), automatically set.

fields.name: BaseClass
fields.description:
The table of the base gamemode to derive from, set automatically by <page>Global.DeriveGamemode</page>.

<note>It is recommended to use <page>Global.DEFINE_BASECLASS</page> when referencing the gamemode's BaseClass to prevent unintended behavior</note>

<note><page>Global.DeriveGamemode</page> modifies the main gamemode's BaseClass, which is shared with parent gamemodes. Because of this, in parent gamemodes the BaseClass can be incorrect, so for instance you need to use `self.BaseClass.BaseClass` in the 1st parent instead</note>

description:
Information about a gamemode.

While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so addons could use their values.
name: GM

fields.name: failed
fields.description:
Function to be called on failure.
<callback>
<arg type="string" name="reason">Reason for the failure.</arg>
</callback>

fields.name: success
fields.description:
Function to be called on success.
<callback>
<arg type="number" name="code">The HTTP result code</arg>
<arg type="string" name="body">The document data, usually HTML or JSON contents.</arg>
<arg type="table" name="headers">List of headers the server provided.</arg>
</callback>

fields.name: method
fields.description:
Request method, case insensitive. Possible values are:
* GET
* POST
* HEAD
* PUT
* DELETE
* PATCH
* OPTIONS

fields.name: url
fields.description: The target url

fields.name: parameters
fields.description:
KeyValue table for parameters. This is only applicable to the following request methods:
* GET
* POST
* HEAD

fields.name: headers
fields.description: KeyValue table for headers

fields.name: body
fields.description: Body string for POST data. If set, will override parameters

fields.name: type
fields.description: Content type for body.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: The timeout for the connection.

fields.name: start
fields.description: The start position of the trace

fields.name: endpos
fields.description: The end position of the trace

fields.name: maxs
fields.description: The 3D vector local to the start/endpos with the highest values. This will represent the corner with the upper bounds of the box.

fields.name: mins
fields.description: The 3D vector local to the start/endpos with the lowest (often negative) values. This will represent the corner with the lower bounds of the box.

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Things the trace should not hit. Can be an entity, a table of entities, a table of entity classes or a function:

<callback>
<arg type="Entity" name="ent">The entity that the trace hit</arg>
<ret type="boolean">Return `true` to hit the entity, `false` to skip it.</ret>
</callback>

Using a function here is super slow. Try to avoid it.

fields.name: mask
fields.description: The trace mask <page>Enums/MASK</page>. This determines what the trace should hit and what it shouldn't hit.

fields.name: collisiongroup
fields.description: The collision group <page>Enums/COLLISION_GROUP</page>. This determines what the trace should hit in regards to the entity's collision group.

fields.name: ignoreworld
fields.description: Should the trace ignore world or not.

fields.name: output
fields.description: If set, the trace result will be written to the supplied table instead of returning a new table

fields.name: whitelist
fields.description: Turns the `filter` field into a whitelist, if it is a table.

fields.name: hitclientonly
fields.description: Enables traces to hit clientside only entities. Keep in mind that most naturally spawned entities are classified as debris, so extra `mask` values might be required.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the light source, see <page>Enums/MATERIAL_LIGHT</page>.

fields.name: color
fields.description: The color of the light source (x is red, y is green, z is blue). Values are not restricted to a specific range, higher values will result in a brighter light.

fields.name: pos
fields.description: The origin of the light in world coordinates.

fields.name: dir
fields.description: The direction of the light. Only required for directional and spot lights.

fields.name: range
fields.description: The maximum range of the light source. Does not actually control light attenuation. Usually left at 0 for infinite range.

fields.name: angularFalloff
fields.description: Angular falloff exponent for spot lights. Higher values result in a sharper transition between the inner cone and the outer cone.

fields.name: innerAngle
fields.description: The inner cone angle for spot lights, in degrees. No angular falloff will occur inside that cone.

fields.name: outerAngle
fields.description: The outer cone angle for spot lights, in degrees.

fields.name: fiftyPercentDistance
fields.description: The distance at which the light will fade to 50% of its brightness.

fields.name: zeroPercentDistance
fields.description: The distance at which the light will completely fade out.

fields.name: quadraticFalloff
fields.description: The quadratic term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.

fields.name: linearFalloff
fields.description: The linear term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.

fields.name: constantFalloff
fields.description: The constant term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the material proxy

fields.name: init
fields.description:
The function used to get variables from the ".vmt". Called once per each ".vmt".

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">The table structure itself</arg>
<arg type="string" name="name">The material name</arg>
<arg type="table" name="values">The material key values</arg>
</callback>

fields.name: bind
fields.description:
The function used to apply the proxy. This is called every frame while any materials with this proxy are used in world.

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">The table structure itself.</arg>
<arg type="string" name="name">The material name.</arg>
<arg type="Entity" name="ent">The entity the material instance is applied to, if any.</arg>
</callback>

fields.name: color
fields.description: The vertex color. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

fields.name: normal
fields.description: The triangles normal required to calculate lighting (Optional).

fields.name: tangent
fields.description: The triangles tangent. Not used by the `VertexLitGeneric` shader.

fields.name: binormal
fields.description: The triangles binormal. Not used by the `VertexLitGeneric` shader.

fields.name: pos
fields.description: The vertex position.

fields.name: u
fields.description: The U texture coordinate.

fields.name: v
fields.description: The V texture coordinate.

fields.name: u1
fields.description: The secondary U texture coordinate. Only works when passed to <page>IMesh:BuildFromTriangles</page>, Useful for `LightmappedGeneric` shader.

fields.name: v1
fields.description: The secondary V texture coordinate. Only works when passed to <page>IMesh:BuildFromTriangles</page>.

fields.name: userdata
fields.description: A table of four numbers. This is used by most shaders in Source to hold tangent information of the vertex ( tangentX, tangentY, tangentZ, tangentHandedness ).

description: Table structure representing a mesh vertex used by various functions, such as <page>IMesh:BuildFromTriangles</page> and <page>Entity:PhysicsFromMesh</page> and returned by functions such as <page>util.GetModelMeshes</page> and  <page>PhysObj:GetMesh</page>.
name: MeshVertex

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The nice name of the NPC for UI display.

fields.name: Class
fields.description: Class name of the entity to spawn.

fields.name: Category
fields.description: Spawnmenu category to put the NPCinto.

fields.name: Weapons
fields.description: A list of weapons this NPC is typically meant to use. One will be picked on spawn at random, unless overwritten by the player.

fields.name: KeyValues
fields.description: Key-value pairs to apply to the NPC on spawn. See <page>Entity:SetKeyValue</page>.

fields.name: Model
fields.description: Model override for this NPC.

fields.name: SpawnFlags
fields.description:
Additional spawnflags for this NPC. See <page>Entity:GetSpawnFlags</page>.

Ignored if `TotalSpawnFlags` key is present.

fields.name: TotalSpawnFlags
fields.description: Total spawnflags override for this NPC.

fields.name: OnCeiling
fields.description: If set to `true`, this NPC can only be spawned on the ceiling. Stacks with `OnFloor`.

fields.name: OnFloor
fields.description: If set to `true`, this NPC can only be spawned on the floor. Stacks with `OnCeiling`.

fields.name: Offset
fields.description: Offset, in Hammer units, away from the surface where the player is looking at for the NPC spawn position.

fields.name: Material
fields.description: Material override for this NPC. See <page>Entity:SetMaterial</page>.

fields.name: Skin
fields.description: Skin override for the NPC. See <page>Entity:SetSkin</page>.

fields.name: NoDrop
fields.description: If set to `true`, do not try to teleport the NPC to the ground.

fields.name: Rotate
fields.description: Used to add additional rotation the NPC post spawn. Usually all NPCs would be facing the player on spawn. Value of `Angle( 0, 180, 0 )` would make the NPC face away from the player.

fields.name: Health
fields.description: Health override for this NPC. Also sets <page>Entity:SetMaxHealth</page>.

fields.name: OnDuplicated
fields.description: If set, a function to be called when the NPC is pasted using the <page>duplicator</page> library.

description:
Information about the NPC data structure, used to define spawnable NPCs for the Sandbox gamemode.

Example usage:
```
list.Set( "NPC", "npc_tf2_ghost", {
Name = "Example NPC",
Class = "npc_tf2_ghost",
Category = "Nextbot"
} )
```
name: NPCData

fields.name: RPM
fields.description: The current RPM of the vehicle

fields.name: gear
fields.description: The current gear of the vehicle, starting from 0

fields.name: isTorqueBoosting
fields.description: Is the vehicle boosting?

fields.name: speed
fields.description: The current speed, in inches per second

fields.name: steeringAngle
fields.description: Steering angle

fields.name: wheelsInContact
fields.description: Wheels on ground

fields.name: translate_x
fields.description: The X coordinate for the top-left corner of the <page>Panel</page> currently being drawn.

fields.name: translate_y
fields.description: The Y coordinate for the top-left corner of the <page>Panel</page> currently being drawn.

fields.name: scissor_left
fields.description: The X coordinate for the left edge of the <page text="ScissorRect">render.SetScissorRect</page> that surrounds the <page>Panel</page> that is currently being drawn.

fields.name: scissor_top
fields.description: The Y coordinate for the top edge of the <page text="ScissorRect">render.SetScissorRect</page> that surrounds the <page>Panel</page> that is currently being drawn.

fields.name: scissor_right
fields.description: The X coordinate for the right edge of the <page text="ScissorRect">render.SetScissorRect</page> that surrounds the <page>Panel</page> that is currently being drawn.

fields.name: scissor_bottom
fields.description: The Y coordinate for the bottom edge of the <page text="ScissorRect">render.SetScissorRect</page> that surrounds the <page>Panel</page> that is currently being drawn.

fields.name: scissor_enabled
fields.description: Whether or not the <page>Panel</page> currently being drawn has <page>render.SetScissorRect</page> active.

fields.name: area
fields.description: The navmesh area this segment occupies.

fields.name: curvature
fields.description: How much of a curve should the bot execute when navigating this segment. 0 = none, 1 = 180

fields.name: distanceFromStart
fields.description: Distance of this segment from the start of the path.

fields.name: forward
fields.description: The direction of travel to reach the end of this segment from the start, represented as a normalised vector.

fields.name: how
fields.description: The direction of travel to reach the end of this segment from the start, represented as a cardinal direction integer 0 to 3, or 9 for vertical movement.

fields.name: ladder
fields.description: The navmesh ladder this segment occupies, if any.

fields.name: length
fields.description: Length of this segment.

fields.name: pos
fields.description: The position of the end of this segment.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The movement type of this segment, indicating how bots are expected to move along this segment.
* 0 is ground movement
* 1 is falling down
* 2 is climbing up or jumping
* 3 is jumping over a gap
* 4 is climbing a ladder up (unused)
* 5 is climbing a ladder down (unused)

description: Structure represents a path segment, returned by <page>PathFollower:GetCurrentGoal</page>, <page>PathFollower:FirstSegment</page> and <page>PathFollower:LastSegment</page>.
name: PathSegment

fields.name: LookAheadTimeObjectsVsObject
fields.description:
Maximum amount of seconds to precalculate collisions with objects.

Default value for this setting is `0.5`.

fields.name: LookAheadTimeObjectsVsWorld
fields.description:
Maximum amount of seconds to precalculate collisions with world.

Default value for this setting is `1`.

fields.name: MaxCollisionChecksPerTimestep
fields.description:
Maximum collision checks per tick.

Objects may penetrate after this many collision checks

Default value for this setting is `50000`.

fields.name: MaxCollisionsPerObjectPerTimestep
fields.description:
Maximum collision per object per tick.

Object will be frozen after this many collisions (visual hitching vs. CPU cost)

Default value for this setting is `10`.

fields.name: MaxVelocity
fields.description:
Maximum world-space speed of an object in inches per second.

Default value for this setting is `4000`.

fields.name: MaxAngularVelocity
fields.description:
Maximum world-space rotational velocity in degrees per second.

Default value for this setting is `7200`.

fields.name: MinFrictionMass
fields.description:
Minimum mass of an object to be affected by friction.

Default value for this setting is `10`.

fields.name: MaxFrictionMass
fields.description:
Maximum mass of an object to be affected by friction.

Default value for this setting is `2500`.

description:
Table used by <page>physenv.SetPerformanceSettings</page> and <page>physenv.GetPerformanceSettings</page>.

When setting the settings, omitting any key will fallback to its current value. (can be retrieved via the get function)
name: PhysEnvPerformanceSettings

fields.name: Pos
fields.description: The entity's world position made local with <page>Global.WorldToLocal</page>

fields.name: Angle
fields.description: The entity's world angles made local with <page>Global.WorldToLocal</page>

fields.name: Frozen
fields.description: Whether the entity is moveable. Equal to (`not` <page>PhysObj:IsMoveable</page>)

fields.name: NoGrav
fields.description: Whether the entity's gravity is affected by gravity or not. <page>PhysObj:IsGravityEnabled</page>

fields.name: Sleep
fields.description: Whether the entity is dormant or not. <page>PhysObj:IsAsleep</page>

description:
Structure used in storing/restoring physics object attributes.
<page>duplicator.GenericDuplicatorFunction</page> and <page>duplicator.DoGenericPhysics</page> use a table of **PhysicsObjectSave**s with the struct's index in the table being the physics object ID.

Pos and Angle are set by the following:

```
Pos, Angle = WorldToLocal(phys:GetPos(), phys:GetAngle(), Vector( 0, 0, 0 ), Angle( 0, 0, 0 ))
```
name: PhysicsObjectSave

fields.name: GravityToggle
fields.description: Enables or disables gravity for the entity

fields.name: Material
fields.description: Sets the physics material for the entity

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: The 'nice' name of the player class for display in User Interface and such.

fields.name: WalkSpeed
fields.description: How fast to move when not running

fields.name: RunSpeed
fields.description: How fast to move when running/sprinting

fields.name: SlowWalkSpeed
fields.description: How fast to move when slow walking, which is activated via the <key>+WALK</key> keybind.

fields.name: CrouchedWalkSpeed
fields.description: Multiply walk speed by this when crouching

fields.name: DuckSpeed
fields.description: How fast to go from not ducking, to ducking

fields.name: UnDuckSpeed
fields.description: How fast to go from ducking, to not ducking

fields.name: JumpPower
fields.description: How powerful a jump should be

fields.name: CanUseFlashlight
fields.description: Can the player use the flashlight

fields.name: MaxHealth
fields.description: Max health we can have

fields.name: MaxArmor
fields.description: Max armor the player can have

fields.name: StartHealth
fields.description: How much health we start with

fields.name: StartArmor
fields.description: How much armour we start with

fields.name: DropWeaponOnDie
fields.description: Do we drop our weapon when we die

fields.name: TeammateNoCollide
fields.description: Do we collide with teammates or run straight through them

fields.name: AvoidPlayers
fields.description: Automatically swerves around other players

fields.name: UseVMHands
fields.description: Uses viewmodel hands

description: This page describes all **default** fields for a <page text="player class">Player_Classes</page>.
name: PLAYER

fields.name: x
fields.description: The x coordinate of the vertex.

fields.name: y
fields.description: The y coordinate of the vertex.

fields.name: u
fields.description: The u texture coordinate of the vertex. `Can be left blank.`

fields.name: v
fields.description: The v texture coordinate of the vertex. `Can be left blank.`

description:
A structure containing vertex information for use with <page>surface.DrawPoly</page>.

UV coordinates describe which part of a given texture should be drawn at a vertex - your graphics card's interpolator will fill in space between vertices. UV coords range from `0-1`, with `0` being top/left and `1` being bottom/right. If you're using a texture these are mandatory.

<note>You must pass a table of tables with this structure to the function. **You need to pass at least 3 points.**

Your points must be defined in a **clockwise order.** Otherwise, your shape will not render properly.</note>
name: PolygonVertex

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: A Table containing all enabled addons.

fields.name: disabled
fields.description: A Table containing all disabled addons.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the Preset.

fields.name: newAction
fields.description: What to do with addons not in the preset. Can be `enable`, `disable` or nothing.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Problem ID.

fields.name: text
fields.description: The Text to Display.

fields.name: severity
fields.description: The Problem severity.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The Problem Type. Possible values are:
* config
* hardware
* addons

fields.name: fix
fields.description: a Function that fixes the Problem.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Can be set to "toggle" to make this property a toggle property.

fields.name: MenuLabel
fields.description: Label to show on opened menu

fields.name: MenuIcon
fields.description: Icon to show on opened menu for this item. Optional for simple properties and unused for toggle properties.

fields.name: StructureField (Order)
fields.description:
Where in the list should the property be positioned, relative to other properties.

For reference, here are the default properties and their Order values:

Property |  Order |
---------|-------|
| Bone Manipulate | 500 |
| Bodygroups | 600 |
| Skin | 601 |
| Keep Upright | 900 |
| Ignite/Extinguish | 999 |
| Remove | 1000 |
| Gravity | 1001 |
| Drive | 1100 |
| Collision | 1500 |
| Statue | 1501 |
| NPC Biggify/Smallify | 1799, 1800 |
| Motion Control (Kinect) | 2500 |
| <page text="Edit Properties">Editable_Entities</page> | 90001 |

fields.name: PrependSpacer
fields.description: Whether to add a spacer before this property. This should generally be true for the first property in a group of properties.

fields.name: Filter
fields.description:
Used **clientside** to decide whether this property should be shown for an entity.

It's good practice to call <page>GM:CanProperty</page> in this hook via <page>gamemode.Call</page> or <page>hook.Run</page>.

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">the property table</arg>
<arg type="Entity" name="ent">the entity the player clicked</arg>
<arg type="Global.LocalPlayer" name="player">the localplayer</arg>
<ret type="boolean" name="check">Return true if the property should be shown for this entity.</ret>
</callback>

fields.name: Checked
fields.description:
Required for toggle properties (clientside).

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">the property table</arg>
<arg type="Entity" name="ent">the entity the player clicked</arg>
<arg type="table" name="tr">the player's eye trace</arg>
<ret type="boolean" name="check">Return true if the property should appear checked in the UI.</ret>
</callback>

fields.name: Action
fields.description:
Called **clientside** when the property is clicked
<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">the property table</arg>
<arg type="Entity" name="ent">the entity the player clicked</arg>
<arg type="table" name="tr">the player's eye trace</arg>
</callback>

When appropriate, within this function you can call `self:MsgStart()`, write data with the <page>net</page>.`Write*` functions, and finish with `self:MsgEnd()`. This will activate the `Receive` function on the server. In most cases, you will want to send the entity to the server, as it's not done by default.

fields.name: Receive
fields.description:
Called **serverside** if the client sends a message in the `Action` function (see above).

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">the property table</arg>
<arg type="number" name="len">the net message length, although this includes the property identifier used internally (the name of the property)</arg>
<arg type="Player" name="ply">the player who clicked the property</arg>
</callback>

You can read data received from the client with the <page>net</page>.`Read*` functions. It's good practice to check <page>GM:CanProperty</page> here via <page>gamemode.Call</page> or <page>hook.Run</page>.

fields.name: MenuOpen
fields.description:
Called **clientside** when the property option has been created in the right-click menu. This is not called for toggle properties!
<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">the property table</arg>
<arg type="DMenuOption" name="option">the menu option</arg>
<arg type="Entity" name="ent">the entity the player right-clicked</arg>
<arg type="table" name="tr">the player's eye trace</arg>
</callback>

fields.name: OnCreate
fields.description:
Same as `MenuOpen`, but also called for toggle properties and has different arguments. This is called immediately after `MenuOpen`, but nothing happens in between so you should only ever use one or the other.
<callback>
<arg type="table" name="self">the property table</arg>
<arg type="DMenu" name="menu">the property menu</arg>
<arg type="DMenuOption" name="option">the menu option</arg>
</callback>

fields.name: x
fields.description: The x position of the view port

fields.name: y
fields.description: The y position of the view port

fields.name: w
fields.description: The width of the view port

fields.name: h
fields.description: The height of the view port

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The type of cam. Valid types are:
* "2D" - No additional arguments are required
* "3D" - Only origin and angles are needed, all other parameters are optional.

fields.name: angles

fields.name: fov

fields.name: aspect
fields.description: The aspect ratio of the view port (Note that this is NOT set to w/h by default)

fields.name: zfar
fields.description: The distance to the far clipping plane

fields.name: znear
fields.description: The distance to the near clipping plane

fields.name: subrect
fields.description: Set to true if this is to draw into a subrect of the larger screen.

fields.name: bloomtone
fields.description: m_bDoBloomAndToneMapping

fields.description:
A table having these keys: ( all floats )
* left
* right
* bottom
* top

fields.name: ortho

If set, makes the view/camera orthogonal. A table having these keys: ( all floats )

* right
* bottom
* top

Used for <page>cam.Start</page>.

Unless stated otherwise, the default values for all these keys would be inherited from the engine's current `CViewSetup` and do not have static representations.
name: RenderCamData

fields.name: format
fields.description:
Format of the capture. Valid formats are:
* `jpeg` or `jpg`
* `png`

fields.name: x
fields.description: X coordinate of the capture origin

fields.name: y
fields.description: Y coordinate of the capture origin

fields.name: w
fields.description: Width of the capture

fields.name: h
fields.description: Height of the capture

fields.name: quality
fields.description: The quality of the capture. Affects jpeg only.

fields.name: alpha
fields.description: Set to false to capture an image with alpha channel set to fully opaque. Affects png only.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Name of the sequence.

fields.name: activityname
fields.description: Name of the activity this sequence is attached to.

fields.name: activity
fields.description: The activity ID associated with this sequence. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

fields.name: actweight
fields.description: How likely this sequence is to be picked when playing an activity its attached to. -1 means this is the only sequence for that activity. (needs validation)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: The looping and other flags of this sequence.

fields.name: numevents
fields.description: Number of animation events this sequence has.

fields.name: bbmin
fields.description: Mins part of the bounding box for this sequence

fields.name: bbmax
fields.description: Maxs part of the bounding box for this sequence

fields.name: fadeintime
fields.description: ideal cross fade in time (0.2 default)

fields.name: fadeouttime
fields.description: ideal cross fade out time (0.2 default)

fields.name: localentrynode
fields.description: transition node at entry

fields.name: localexitnode
fields.description: transition node at exit

fields.name: nodeflags
fields.description: Transition rules

fields.name: lastframe
fields.description: Frame that should generate EndOFSequence

fields.name: nextseq
fields.description: If non 0, the next sequence for auto advancing sequences

fields.name: cycleposeindex
fields.description: If non 0, index of pose parameter to be used as cycle index. This means that the sequence playback will be controlled by a pose parameter.

fields.name: anims
fields.description: A 1-based array of all animationIDs associated with this sequence. For use with <page>Entity:GetAnimInfo</page>.

fields.name: GameDir
fields.description: The game directory to get the servers for

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of servers to retrieve. Valid values are `internet`, `favorite`, `history` and `lan`

fields.name: AppID
fields.description: Steam application ID to get the servers for

fields.name: Callback
fields.description:
Called when a new server is found and queried.

<callback>
<arg type="number" name="ping">Latency to the server.</arg>
<arg type="string" name="name">Name of the server</arg>
<arg type="string" name="desc">"Nice" gamemode name</arg>
<arg type="string" name="map">Current map</arg>
<arg type="number" name="players">Total player number ( bot + human )</arg>
<arg type="number" name="maxplayers">Maximum reported amount of players</arg>
<arg type="number" name="botplayers">Amount of bots on the server</arg>
<arg type="boolean" name="pass">Whether this server has password or not</arg>
<arg type="number" name="lastplayed">Time when you last played on this server, as UNIX timestamp or 0</arg>
<arg type="string" name="address">IP Address of the server</arg>
<arg type="string" name="gamemode">Gamemode folder name</arg>
<arg type="number" name="workshopid">Gamemode Steam Workshop ID</arg>
<arg type="boolean" name="isanon">Is the server signed into an anonymous account?</arg>
<arg type="string" name="version">Version number, same format as <page>jit.version_num</page></arg>
<arg type="string" name="localization">Two digit country code, `us` if <page>nil</page></arg>
<arg type="string" name="gmcategory">Category of the gamemode, ex. `pvp`, `pve`, `rp` or `roleplay`</arg>

<ret type="boolean" name="stop">Return `false` to stop the query.</ret>
</callback>

fields.name: CallbackFailed
fields.description: Called if the query has failed, called with the servers IP Address

fields.name: Finished
fields.description: Called when the query is finished. No arguments

fields.name: secondstoarrive
fields.description:
How long it takes to move to the set pos and angle. Limited by max speed/damping.
<warning>Cannot be 0! Will give errors if you do.</warning>

fields.name: delta
fields.description: The time it should use - just use the one from <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page>.

fields.name: pos
fields.description: Where you want to move to.

fields.name: angle
fields.description: Angle you want to move to.

fields.name: maxangular
fields.description: What should be the maximal angular force applied.

fields.name: maxangulardamp
fields.description: At which force/speed should it start damping the rotation.

fields.name: maxspeed
fields.description: Maximum linear force applied

fields.name: maxspeeddamp
fields.description: Maximum linear force/speed before damping.

fields.name: dampfactor
fields.description: The percentage it should damp the linear/angular force if it reaches it's max amount

fields.name: teleportdistance
fields.description: If it's further away than this it'll teleport (Set to 0 to not teleport)

description: Table used by <page>PhysObj:ComputeShadowControl</page>. Default values are given if the table element is omitted.
name: ShadowControlParams

fields.name: sound
fields.description:
Path to the sound file to be used in this sound effect, relative to `sound/` directory (so exclude the `sound/` part).

Can be a table of sound files, in which case the sound will be chosen randomly every time from the provided list.

Each sound path can be prepended with a special character for special effects. You can learn more about this [here](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Soundscripts#Sound_Characters).

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the soundscript, to be referenced by in functions such as <page>Entity:EmitSound</page>.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The sound channel to play in. See <page>Enums/CHAN</page>

fields.name: level
fields.description: The soundlevel of the sound in dB. See <page>Enums/SNDLVL</page>. This will affect how far the sound can be heard.

fields.name: volume
fields.description:
The volume of the sound as a decimal between `0` and `1`. Can be a table of two numbers, a minimum and a maximum value.

**Warning:** Volume of `0` will act as volume of `1`

fields.name: pitch
fields.description: The pitch of the sound. Can be a table of two numbers, a minimum and a maximum value.

fields.name: pitchstart
fields.description:
The initial pitch.
<warning>Deprecated, use pitch.</warning>

fields.name: pitchend
fields.description:
The pitch end.
<warning>Deprecated, use pitch.</warning>

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Origin of the sound hint

fields.name: owner
fields.description: Owner of the sound hint, if any (emitting entity, like a thumper)

fields.name: target
fields.description: Target of the sound hint, if any

fields.name: volume
fields.description: Volume of the sound hint

fields.name: type
fields.description: <page text="SOUND_ enums">Enums/SOUND</page>

fields.name: expiration
fields.description: <page text="CurTime">Global.CurTime</page> based expiration date

fields.name: expires
fields.description: Does this sound hint expire?

fields.name: channel
fields.description: <page text="CHAN_ enums">Enums/CHAN</page>

description: Table describing a sound hint, used by <page>NPC:GetBestSoundHint</page> and <page>sound.GetLoudestSoundHint</page>.
name: SoundHintData

fields.name: direction
fields.description: The suns direction relative to 0,0,0

fields.name: obstruction
fields.description: Indicates how obstructed the sun is, 1 not visible, 0 fully visible

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the surface property, identical to <page>util.GetSurfacePropName</page>.

fields.name: hardnessFactor
fields.description: How hard a surface is. If this is greater than or equal to another surfaces's hardThreshold, a hard impact sound will be used.

fields.name: hardThreshold
fields.description: Hardness threshold for impact sounds. HitSurface.hardnessFactor >= InflictorSurface.hardThreshold - hard impact sound (depends on hardVelocityThreshold's value), HitSurface.hardnessFactor < InflictorSurface.hardThreshold - soft impact sound (always).

fields.name: hardVelocityThreshold
fields.description: Velocity threshold for impact sounds. impactSpeed >= HitSurface.hardVelocityThreshold - hard impact sound (depends on hardThreshold's value), impactSpeed < HitSurface.hardVelocityThreshold - soft impact sound (always).

fields.name: reflectivity
fields.description: Amount of sound reflected from the surface represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0 - no reflection, 1 - fully reflected.

fields.name: roughnessFactor
fields.description: How rough a surface is. If this is greater than or equal to another surfaces's roughThreshold, a rough scrape sound will be used.

fields.name: roughThreshold
fields.description: Roughness threshold for friction sounds. HitSurface.roughnessFactor >= InflictorSurface.roughThreshold - rough friction sound, HitSurface.roughnessFactor < InflictorSurface.roughThreshold - soft friction sound.

fields.name: climbable
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the surface is a ladder. Used to detect whether a player is on a ladder. 0 - false, > 0 - true.

fields.name: jumpFactor
fields.description: Scalar multiplier for player jump height - or more accurately, applied z-axis velocity on a surface. For example, 1 - normal jump, 2 - twice as high, and 0.5 - half as high.

fields.name: material
fields.description: The surface material. See <page>Enums/MAT</page>.

fields.name: maxSpeedFactor
fields.description: Scalar multiplier for player speed. Achieves this by multiplying <page>CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed</page> in <page>GM:Move</page>.

fields.name: dampening
fields.description: This is the physical drag on an object when in contact with this surface (0 - x, 0 none to x a lot).

fields.name: density
fields.description: Material density in kg / m^3 (water is 1000). If a surface's density is < 1000, it will float in water. This is used to calculate the total mass of an object.

fields.name: elasticity
fields.description: Collision elasticity - used to compute coefficient of restitution represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0.01 is soft, 1.0 is hard.

fields.name: friction
fields.description: Physical friction used to slow entities touching the surface represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0.01 is slick, 1.0 is completely rough.

fields.name: thickness
fields.description: Material thickness. If this is 0, the material is not volumetrically solid, and thus the object mass will be calculated as "volume * 0.0254^3 * density" where 0.0254 is meters per inch. If non-zero, the mass will be "surfacearea * thickness * 0.0254^3 * density".

fields.name: breakSound
fields.description: Sound to play when a prop or func_breakable is broken.

fields.name: bulletImpactSound
fields.description: Bullet impact sound with this surface.

fields.name: impactHardSound
fields.description: Physical impact sound when hitting surfaces hard.

fields.name: impactSoftSound
fields.description: Physical impact sound when hitting surfaces softly.

fields.name: rollingSound
fields.description: Unused sound.

fields.name: scrapeRoughSound
fields.description: Friction sound when roughly scraping against an entity.

fields.name: scrapeSmoothSound
fields.description: Friction sound when smoothly scraping against an entity.

fields.name: stepLeftSound
fields.description: Footstep sound for left foot.

fields.name: stepRightSound
fields.description: Footstep sound for right foot.

fields.name: strainSound
fields.description: Unused sound.

fields.name: ClassName
fields.description:
Entity class name of the SWEP (file or folder name of your SWEP). This is
set automatically

fields.name: ClassNameOverride
fields.description: If set, overrides the classname of the SWEP.

fields.name: Category
fields.description:
The spawn menu category that this weapon
resides in.

fields.name: Spawnable
fields.description:
Whether or not this weapon can be obtained through the
spawn menu.

fields.name: AdminOnly
fields.description:
If spawnable, this variable determines whether only
administrators can use the button in the spawn menu.

fields.name: PrintName
fields.description: The name of the SWEP displayed in the spawn menu.

fields.name: Base
fields.description: The weapon's base script, relative to `lua/weapons`.

fields.name: m_WeaponDeploySpeed
fields.description:
The deploy speed multiplier. This does not change the
internal deployment speed.

fields.name: Owner
fields.description: <warning>Deprecated, use <page>Entity:GetOwner</page>() instead.</warning>

fields.name: Weapon
fields.description: <warning>Deprecated, use `SWEP` instead. However, if called in a method; use `self` instead.</warning>

fields.name: Author
fields.description: The SWEP's author.

fields.name: Contact
fields.description: The contact information regarding the SWEP's author.

fields.name: Purpose
fields.description: The purpose of the SWEP.

fields.name: Instructions
fields.description: The instructions regarding the SWEP's usage.

fields.name: ViewModel
fields.description: Relative path to the SWEP's view model.

fields.name: ViewModelFlip
fields.description: Used primarily for Counter Strike: Source view models, this variable is used to flip them back to normal.

fields.name: ViewModelFlip1
fields.description: Behaves similarly to `ViewModelFlip`, but for the second view model.

fields.name: ViewModelFlip2
fields.description: Behaves similarly to `ViewModelFlip`, but for the third view model.

fields.name: ViewModelFOV
fields.description: The field of view percieved whilst wielding this `SWEP`.

fields.name: WorldModel
fields.description: Relative path to the SWEP's world model.

fields.name: AutoSwitchFrom
fields.description:
Whether this weapon can be autoswitched
away from when the player runs out of ammo in this weapon or picks up another weapon or ammo

fields.name: AutoSwitchTo
fields.description:
Whether this weapon can be autoswitched to
when the player runs out of ammo in their current weapon or they pick this weapon up

fields.name: Weight
fields.description:
Determines the priority of the weapon when
autoswitching. The weapon being autoswitched from will attempt to switch to a weapon with the same weight
that has ammo, but if none exists, it will prioritise higher weight weapons.

fields.name: BobScale
fields.description:
The scale of the viewmodel bob (viewmodel movement
from left to right when walking around)

fields.name: SwayScale
fields.description:
The scale of the viewmodel sway (viewmodel
position lerp when looking around).

fields.name: BounceWeaponIcon
fields.description:
Should the weapon icon bounce in weapon
selection?

fields.name: DrawWeaponInfoBox
fields.description:
Should draw the weapon selection info
box, containing SWEP.Instructions, etc.

fields.name: DrawAmmo
fields.description: Should we draw the default HL2 ammo counter?

fields.name: DrawCrosshair
fields.description: Should we draw the default crosshair?

fields.name: RenderGroup
fields.description: The SWEP render group, see <page>Enums/RENDERGROUP</page>. If unset, the engine will decide the render group based on the SWEPs world model.

fields.name: Slot
fields.description: Slot in the weapon selection menu, starts with `0`

fields.name: SlotPos
fields.description: Position in the slot, should be in the range `0-128`

fields.name: SpeechBubbleLid
fields.description: Internal variable for drawing the info box in weapon selection

fields.name: WepSelectIcon
fields.description:
Path to
an texture. Override this in your SWEP to set the icon in the weapon selection. This must be the texture ID,
see <page>surface.GetTextureID</page>. Alternatively you can render custom weapon selection via <page>WEAPON:DrawWeaponSelection</page>.

fields.name: CSMuzzleFlashes
fields.description:
Should we use Counter-Strike muzzle
flashes upon firing? This is required for DoD:S or CS:S view models to fix their muzzle flashes.

fields.name: CSMuzzleX
fields.description:
Use the X shape muzzle flash instead of the
default Counter-Strike muzzle flash. Requires <page text="CSMuzzleFlashes">Structures/SWEP#CSMuzzleFlashes</page> to be set to true.

fields.name: Primary
fields.description:
Primary attack settings. The table contains these fields:

* <page>string</page> `Ammo` - Ammo type (`Pistol`, `SMG1`, etc.) See <page>game.AddAmmoType</page>.
* <page>number</page> `ClipSize` - The maximum amount of bullets one clip can hold. Setting it to `-1` means weapon uses no clips, like a grenade or a rocket launch.
* <page>number</page> `DefaultClip` - Default ammo in the clip, making it higher than ClipSize will give player additional ammo on spawn
* <page>boolean</page> `Automatic` - If true makes the weapon shoot automatically as long as the player has primary attack button held down

fields.name: Secondary
fields.description: Secondary attack settings, has same fields as Primary attack settings

fields.name: UseHands
fields.description:
Makes the player models hands bonemerged onto
the view model

<warning>The gamemode and view models **must** support this feature for it to work!
You can find more information here: <page text="Using Viewmodel Hands">Using_Viewmodel_Hands</page>
</warning>

fields.name: Folder
fields.description:
The folder from where the weapon was loaded. This should always be
"weapons/weapon_myweapon", regardless whether your SWEP is stored as a file, or multiple files in a folder.
It is set automatically on load

fields.name: AccurateCrosshair
fields.description:
Makes the default SWEP crosshair be
positioned in 3D space where your aim actually is (like on Jeep), instead of simply sitting in the middle of
the screen at all times

fields.name: DisableDuplicator
fields.description:
Disable the ability for players to duplicate this
SWEP

fields.name: ScriptedEntityType
fields.description:
Sets the spawnmenu content icon type
for the entity, used by spawnmenu in the Sandbox-derived gamemodes.
See <page>spawnmenu.AddContentType</page> for more information.

fields.name: m_bPlayPickupSound
fields.description:
If set to false, the weapon will not play the
weapon pick up sound when picked up.

fields.name: IconOverride
fields.description:
If set,
overrides the icon path to be displayed in the Spawnmenu for this entity.

description:
Information about <page text="Scripted Weapons">Scripted_Entities</page> (SWEPs),
used by <page>SANDBOX:PlayerGiveSWEP</page> and in SWEP creation.

For list of callbacks, see <page text="WEAPON Hooks">WEAPON_Hooks</page>.

While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so
addons could use their values.
name: SWEP

fields.name: Color
fields.description: Color of the team

fields.name: Joinable
fields.description: Whether the team is joinable or not.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the team

fields.name: Score
fields.description: Score of the team

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text to be drawn.

fields.name: font
fields.description: The font to draw with. List of default fonts can be found <page text="here">Default_Fonts</page>.

fields.name: pos
fields.description: This holds the X and Y coordinates. Key value 1 is x, key value 2 is y.

fields.name: xalign
fields.description: The alignment of the X position. See <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>

fields.name: yalign
fields.description: The alignment of the Y position. See <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>

fields.name: color
fields.description: The text color

fields.name: texture
fields.description: surface.GetTextureID number of the texture to be drawn.

fields.name: x
fields.description: The x Coordinate.

fields.name: y
fields.description: The y Coordinate.

fields.name: w
fields.description: The width of the texture.

fields.name: h
fields.description: The height of the texture.

fields.name: color
fields.description: The texture color. See <page>Color</page>.

fields.name: AddToMenu
fields.description: If set to false, the tool won't be added to the tool menu and players will have to access it by other means.

fields.name: Category
fields.description: The tool menu category under which the tool should be listed.

fields.name: Command
fields.description: The console command to execute upon being selected in the Q menu.

fields.name: Name
fields.description:
The name of the tool in the Q menu.
Common practice is to set this to "#tool.[lua filename].name" to match the name displayed in the tool information box.

fields.name: ClientConVar
fields.description:
A key-value ( convar name-default value ) table containing the client-side convars to create. All convars will be prefixed with the filename of the tool.
You can later use <page>Tool:GetClientNumber</page> or <page>Tool:GetClientInfo</page> to retrieve these values.

fields.name: ServerConVar
fields.description: Same as above, but created server-side instead.

fields.name: ClientConVars
fields.description: A key-value ( <page>string</page> name - <page>ConVar</page> object ) table containing the cached convar objected created from `ClientConVar`.

fields.name: ServerConVars
fields.description: Same as above, but server-side (`ServerConVar`) instead.

fields.name: BuildCPanel
fields.description:
The function that is called to build the context menu for your tool. It has one argument, namely the context menu's base panel to which all of your custom panels are going to be parented to.

While it might sound like a hook, it isn't - you won't receive a `self` argument inside the function. See <page>TOOL.BuildCPanel</page>.

fields.name: Information
fields.description:
Allows you to override the tool usage information shown when the tool is equipped.
See <page>Tool Information Display</page> for more information.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
Class name of the tool. (name of the .lua file)

This is set automatically.

fields.name: Tab
fields.description: The tool tab (<page>spawnmenu.AddToolTab</page>) to add this tool to. (The internal name, first argument)

fields.name: LeftClickAutomatic
fields.description: When enabled the game tries to run the left mouse click as soon as possible

fields.name: RightClickAutomatic
fields.description: When enabled the game tries to run the right mouse click as soon as possible

description:
The **TOOL** table is used in Sandbox tool creation. You can find a list of callbacks on the  page and a list of methods on the  page. Do note that some of the fields below have no effect on server-side operations.

The tool information box drawn on the HUD while your tool is selected has 2 values that are set by <page>language.Add</page>.
* `tool.[tool mode].name` - The tool name (Note this is NOT the same as TOOL.Name)
* `tool.[tool mode].desc` - The tool description

Ensure that all tool file names are entirely lowercase.  Including capital letters can lead to unintended behavior.
name: TOOL

fields.name: x
fields.description: The x coordinate on the players screen

fields.name: y
fields.description: The y coordinate on the players screen

fields.name: visible
fields.description: The coordinate is not behind the player. **This does not mean the coordinate is on the screen.** When this is false, it means that the coordinate would not be on the screen even if the player had a full 180 degree FOV.

fields.name: start
fields.description: The start position of the trace

fields.name: endpos
fields.description: The end position of the trace

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Things the trace should not hit. Can be an entity, a table of entities, a table of entity classes or a function:

<callback>
<arg type="Entity" name="ent">The entity that the trace hit</arg>
<ret type="boolean">Return `true` to hit the entity, `false` to skip it.</ret>
</callback>

Using a function here is super slow. Try to avoid it.

fields.name: mask
fields.description: The trace mask <page>Enums/MASK</page>. This determines what the trace should hit and what it shouldn't hit. A mask is a combination of <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page> - you can use these for more advanced masks.

fields.name: collisiongroup
fields.description: The collision group <page>Enums/COLLISION_GROUP</page>. This determines what the trace should hit in regards to the entity's collision group.

fields.name: ignoreworld
fields.description: Should the trace ignore world or not

fields.name: output
fields.description: If set, the trace result will be written to the supplied table instead of returning a new table

fields.name: whitelist
fields.description: Turns the `filter` field into a whitelist, if it is a table.

fields.name: hitclientonly
fields.description: Enables traces to hit clientside only entities. Keep in mind that most naturally spawned entities are classified as debris, so extra `mask` values might be required.

fields.name: Entity
fields.description: The entity hit by the trace.

fields.name: Fraction
fields.description: This indicates the how much of your trace length was used from 0-1 (resultLength/originalLength).

fields.name: FractionLeftSolid
fields.description: Given the trace started in a solid enviroment, this will return at what distance the trace left the solid from 0-1. Doesn't work if the trace hit a non-worldspawn entity.

fields.name: Hit
fields.description: Indicates whether the trace hit something.

fields.name: HitBox
fields.description: The ID of the hitbox hit by the trace.

fields.name: HitGroup
fields.description: <page>Enums/HITGROUP</page> describing what hitgroup the trace hit (not the same as HitBox).

fields.name: HitNoDraw
fields.description: Indicates whenever the trace hit a no-draw brush.

fields.name: HitNonWorld
fields.description: Indicates whenever the trace did not hit the world.

fields.name: HitNormal
fields.description: The direction of the surface that was hit as a normal vector (vector with <page text="length">Vector:Length</page> of 1).

fields.name: HitPos
fields.description: The position the trace stopped. This will be the provided endpos if the trace hit nothing.

fields.name: HitSky
fields.description: Indicates whenever the trace hit the sky.

fields.name: HitTexture
fields.description: The surface material (not texture) of whatever the trace hit. Will be `**displacement**` if the trace hit a displacement, and `**studio**` if it hit a prop.

fields.name: HitWorld
fields.description: Indicates whenever the trace hit the world.

fields.name: MatType
fields.description: <page>Enums/MAT</page> of the material hit by the trace.

fields.name: Normal
fields.description:
The direction of the trace as a normal vector (vector with <page text="length">Vector:Length</page> of 1).

Equivalent to: `( traceRes.HitPos - traceRes.StartPos ):Normalize()`

fields.name: PhysicsBone
fields.description:
The <page>PhysObj</page> ID that was hit.

Used for <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page>.

fields.name: StartPos
fields.description: The origin of the trace. Will match the provided startpos.

fields.name: SurfaceProps
fields.description:
ID of hit surface property from `scripts/surfaceproperties.txt`.
You can get the name using <page>util.GetSurfacePropName</page>.

Used for <page>CEffectData:SetSurfaceProp</page>.

fields.name: StartSolid
fields.description: Indicates whenever the trace started in a solid enviroment.

fields.name: AllSolid
fields.description: True if the entire trace is inside a solid.

fields.name: SurfaceFlags
fields.description: The surface flags of the hit surface. See <page>Enums/SURF</page>.

fields.name: DispFlags
fields.description: The displacement flags of the hit surface. See <page>Enums/DISPSURF</page>.

fields.name: Contents
fields.description: The contents of the hit surface. See <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page>.

description:
Table structure used as trace result. Default values are when the trace hits nothing.

See <page>util.TraceLine</page> and <page>util.TraceHull</page>.
name: TraceResult

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Workshop item ID

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the Workshop item

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the Workshop item

fields.name: fileid
fields.description: The internal File ID of the workshop item, if any

fields.name: previewid
fields.description: The internal File ID of the workshop item preview, if any

fields.name: previewurl
fields.description: A URL to the preview image of the workshop item

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The SteamID64 of the original uploader of the addon

fields.name: created
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the item was created

fields.name: updated
fields.description: Unix timestamp of when the file was last updated

fields.name: banned
fields.description: Whether the file is banned or not

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Comma (,) separated list of tags, may be truncated to some length

fields.name: size
fields.description: File size of the workshop item contents

fields.name: previewsize
fields.description: Filesize of the preview file

fields.name: installed
fields.description: If the addon is subscribed, this value represents whether it is installed on the client and its files are accessible, false otherwise.

fields.name: disabled
fields.description: If the addon is subscribed, this value represents whether it is disabled on the client, false otherwise.

fields.name: children
fields.description:
A list of child Workshop Items for this item.

For collections this will be sub-collections, for workshop items this will be the items they depend on.

fields.name: ownername
fields.description:
<warning>We advise against using this. It may be changed or removed in a future update.</warning>

The "nice" name of the Uploader, or "Unnammed Player" if we failed to get the data for some reason.

Do not use this field as it will most likely not be updated in time. Use <page>steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo</page> instead.

fields.name: error
fields.description:
If this key is set, no other data will be present in the response.

Values above 0 represent Steam Error codes, values below 0 mean the following:
* -1 means Failed to create query
* -2 means Failed to send query
* -3 means Received 0 or more than 1 result
* -4 means Failed to get item data from the response
* -5 means Workshop item ID in the response is invalid
* -6 means Workshop item ID in response is mismatching the requested file ID

fields.name: score

fields.description:
Maximum speed while boosting

<warning>The <page>Vehicle:SetVehicleParams</page> function takes this in **miles per hour**, but <page>Vehicle:GetVehicleParams</page> returns this in **hammer units per second**!

In this case HU = inches, so 1 MPH is 17.6 HU/s.</warning>

fields.description:
A table of numbers, of gear rations.

Table length is equal to "gearCount" member of this table.

fields.name: horsepower
fields.description:
The HP amount of the vehicle

This value is used to calculate the effectively applied torque, along with ratios and `maxRPM`.

fields.name: isAutoTransmission
fields.description: If `true`, the gearbox shifts gears, if `false` the gearbox stays stuck to the 1st gear (gear number 0).

fields.name: maxRPM
fields.description:
Maximum RPM of the vehicle.

Despite this being a maximum value, the vehicle can exceed it.

<warning>Attempts to exceed the max RPM will force the active gear ratio to be that of the 1st gear, which will provide even more torque. This is the opposite of a rev limiter. This value is only used for the calculation of the effectively applied torque.</warning>

fields.name: maxRevSpeed
fields.description:
Maximum reverse speed of the vehicle

<warning>The <page>Vehicle:SetVehicleParams</page> function takes this in **miles per hour**, but <page>Vehicle:GetVehicleParams</page> returns this in **hammer units per second**!

In this case HU = inches, so 1 MPH is 17.6 HU/s.</warning>

fields.name: maxSpeed
fields.description:
Maximum forward going speed of the vehicle without boosting

<warning>The <page>Vehicle:SetVehicleParams</page> function takes this in **miles per hour**, but <page>Vehicle:GetVehicleParams</page> returns this in **hammer units per second**!

In this case HU = inches, so 1 MPH is 17.6 HU/s.</warning>

description:
Table structure passed to <page>SANDBOX:PlayerSpawnVehicle</page>, describing a spawnable Vehicle in Sandbox gamemode.

Example usage in defined a custom spawnable vehicle:
```
list.Set( "Vehicles", "Jeep", {
-- Required information
Name = "Jeep",
Model = "models/buggy.mdl",
Class = "prop_vehicle_jeep_old",
Category = "Half-Life 2",

-- Optional information
Author = "VALVe",
Information = "The regular old jeep",

KeyValues = {
vehiclescript = "scripts/vehicles/jeep_test.txt"
}
} )
```

fields.name: viewid

fields.name: offcenter
fields.description:
This allows you to "zoom in" on a part of the screen - for example, the top-left quarter of the screen. This is similar to how [poster splits the screen](https://garry.blog/poster-screenshots/) into separate renders.

It's a table with 4 keys, controlling what portion of the screen to draw:
* left - where the left edge starts. Natural value is 0.
* right - where the right edge ends. Natural value is equal to w (the width of the viewport).
* top - where the `bottom` edge starts. Natural value is 0.
* bottom - where the `top` edge ends. Natural value is equal to h (the height of the viewport).

Note that top and bottom are reversed.

Values outside the viewport are allowed, but not recommended - instead you should increase the view FOV.

description:
Table structure used for <page>render.RenderView</page>.

Unless stated otherwise, the default values for all these keys would be inherited from the engine's CViewSetup and do not have static representations.

fields.name: offcenter
fields.description:
It's a table with 4 keys, controlling what portion of the screen to draw:
* left - where the left edge starts. Natural value is 0.
* right - where the right edge ends. Natural value is equal to w (the width of the viewport).
* top - where the `bottom` edge starts. Natural value is 0.
* bottom - where the `top` edge ends. Natural value is equal to h (the height of the viewport).

Note that top and bottom are reversed.

This will not be present if offscreen rendering is not enabled for this view.

See <page>Structures/ViewData</page> for more info.
